metadata.title: HHS Public Access Author manuscript Simultaneous Intranasal/Intravascular Antibody Labeling of CD4 + T Cells in Mouse Lungs

abstract.original_text: 1 g KHCO 3 8.3 g NH 4 Cl 37.2 mg EDTA-Na 2 Adjust volume to 1,000 ml with nano-pure H 2 O and filter through a 0.2 µm filter Store at room temperature

sentences.segment_text: 1 g KHCO 3 8.3 g NH 4 Cl 37.2 mg EDTA-Na 2 Adjust volume to 1,000 ml with nano-pure H 2 O and filter through a 0.2 µm filter Store at room temperature

abstract.original_text: CD4 + T cell responses have been shown to be protective in many respiratory virus infections. In the respiratory tract, CD4 + T cells include cells in the airway and parenchyma and cells adhering to the pulmonary vasculature. Here we discuss in detail the methods that are useful for characterizing CD4 + T cells in different anatomic locations in mouse lungs.
